Activity: Log in, check emails, and prioritize tasks for the week. Make a cup of tea – Earl Grey, my favorite – and settle in.

Begin reviewing documentation of the current EHR system. Specifically focusing on modules related to data collection, reporting, and patient demographics. Make notes of sections relevant to influenza tracking.

Schedule a meeting with @his-1 and @his-2 (Health Informatics Specialists) to discuss the current EHR data structure and reporting capabilities related to influenza data. Topic: 'EHR Data Structure and Reporting for Influenza'.

Initial meeting with @his-1 and @his-2 to discuss current EHR data structure and reporting limitations regarding influenza data collection. Gather insights on existing data fields, reporting tools, and potential integration challenges.
Research best practices for influenza data collection within EHR systems. Review CDC guidelines and relevant industry standards to inform gap analysis.
Lunch Break - Grab a sandwich from the cafeteria and chat with colleagues.
Continue EHR system assessment. Focus on identifying specific data fields (e.g., vaccination status, symptoms, diagnosis codes) that are currently missing or inadequately captured.
Start documenting identified gaps in data collection related to influenza. Create a preliminary list of required data fields and workflow modifications.
Draft an email to @clinlead-1 (Clinical Lead) to schedule a meeting to discuss clinical requirements for influenza data collection. Topic: 'Clinical Requirements for Influenza Data'.
Prepare the agenda for the meeting with the clinical lead.
Continue working on gap analysis documentation. Refine list of missing data elements.
Review tasks and plan for tomorrow. Check email and respond to urgent requests.
